title: Infrastructure Chair for Women in Computer Science [current]
description: Maintaining the technical infrastructure behind UIUC's Women in Computer Science organization
Leading a team of 10 people through a variety of projects related to web development and full-stack development

title: Software Development Intern at Atlassian
description: Worked on adding pull request labels, a highly requested feature, into Bitbucket Cloud’s pull requests using React and Typescript
Incorporated new database models and endpoints into the Bitbucket Cloud API with Python’s Django to support the feature
Implemented other fixes to both the frontend and backend of Bitbucket Cloud to support the team’s projects

title: Software Development Intern at Citi
description: Performed cloud migration for essential microservices under the Branded Cards Middleware Team
Developed automated validation scripts for developers to utilize to make configuration changes more efficient
Undertook a side project to develop a full-stack database visualization project from scratch using SQL and Java Spring Boot

title: Reflections | Projections Co-Director
description: Reflections | Projections (R|P) is the midwest's largest student run technology conference, and brings in 2000+ attendees as well as 30+ comapnies and speakers every year
Led the team of 40 staff members, including 10 team leads, in order to acquire corporate partnerships, determine week-of logistics, and develop our new attendee tracking system

title: CS STARS
description: Participated in a research project focusing on Human Computer Interaction and Usable Security and Privacy under Dr. Camille Cobb
Utilized Python libraries to scrape and collect information about television shows directed towards teen audiences, and developed detailed visualizations to hypothesize about the findings
Worked on a variety of leadership activities that catered to college and high school students to broaden participation of underrepresented individuals in computer science.

title: Teaching Assistant at Codinu
description: Instructed students on the fundamentals of Python and Scratch, and led both technical and unplugged lessons on computer science principles
Provided individualized support, troubleshooting, and conceptual clarification during both summer camps and evening classes.
